summary: A gang of baseball playing kids manage to get hold of a model NASA rocket belonging to one of their parents. When they accidentally shoot it into a nearby junkyard, they have to make a plan to get past a super-ferocious, mutated guard dog known as "The Great Fear".

reviews.content: I thought Sandlot2 was a Great Summer Movie Classic.  A group of Neighborhood kids getting together to play baseball for fun and good times (I never played baseball Every day personally), but this movie brings back a certain degree of nostalgia.
Should stick to the original

A mini masterpiece! 
I don't know what people who panned this are thinking, do they not get that this is for kids and light-hearted entertainment? The movie is genuinely funny, the characters are likeable, the acting is great, and the story is well written and imaginitive. The first film was also great, and I think they managed to top it with this sequel. We loved it! If you enjoy movies like A Christmas Story and Holes, give this a try. The hokey humor and non-realism (like the Space Shuttle) are intentional, and part of the storytelling. This is how a kid remembers things. A+ !
LOL, the funniest 01 hour: and 43 minutes ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

sandlot 1 kids in a baseball field scared of dog goliath
they hoist up a kid over the fence to get a ball
finally find out dogs not viscous and they should have just knocked 

sandlot 2 - kids in a baseball field scared of dog goliath.
they hoist up a CAT over the fence to get a rocket
finally find out dogs not viscous and they should have just knocked 

2 differences first is in 1962, second one adds girls.
Dont waste your time, they pretty much remade it EXACT except the years and added girls. maybe they could have AT LEAST changed the plot. i watched em back to back and it felt like #2 was just a bad REMAKE not a sequel.
God awful to call this a sequel to the classic
This was an ABSOLUTE COPY CAT of the first film. I seriously don't understand what David M. Evans was thinking, making a sequel.
You don't strike gold again with a sequel with a plot so derivative of the original's, but not as well done and without the belly laughs of the first flick.
One of the worst sequels to a loved film is Sandlot 2. With its wannabe screenplay it looks up at the first Sandlot with sorrow. Its more of a floppy remake than a second adaptation.

This is the second worst movie of all time, the sequel to this is the worst one. Why are there washing machines why doesnt he ask his brother to get the ball why is it a rocket why did you make a second one. My 6 year old baseball loving brother was so excited for his movie but when he saw this movie, he said "women can't play ball" he started to cry for 2 day straight. He has never watched a baseball game or movie since
Terrible acting and lazy writers who attempted to inject feminism into the plot.
To be honest , it was a remake of the original and it wasn't even good. It has the same plot and everything.
Horrendous movie!  Don't waste your time watching such crap!

Making a sequel hay it was not bad at all I enjoyed it we have new characters plus a new plot to the movie it was a silly movie you should check it out! For me I find it motivates me to play baseball and I love sports! So batter up to check out the movie!
Barely got through it, worst sequel imaginable.
I dont get it! I think the FIRST  One will always be The best one!!
Think of a really bad school play combined with The Sandlot. That's what this movie is....maybe a little worse; because a play at least has new things brought to the table sometimes
The Sandlot is back hay having it be a sequel I would say past which is a good thing I liked it

In a film set in 1973 Max lloyd jones,samantha burton, sean berdy, brett kelly, james wilsonstar are a group of young boys who plan to spend their summer playing baseball at a sandlot baseball field. They soon find out a group of girls have already claimed the field they soon come to a conclusion but another older baseball team tries to take the field for practice but the sandlot squad doesn't let up easy. This movie is directed by David mickey Evans who has also made Beethoven 2, 3, and 4, Radio flyer, Smitty  and also many more. I think there are way more strengths than weaknesses in this movie. This movie has a bunch of jokes fulfilling the comedy part and also has some action to keep you on your toes,This movie is good for any age. However the film isn't exactly organized because it features various changes of events, also others complain that this film doesn't really relate to the first sandlott which can be a problem to some. Although the actors do a great job in the movie which also sets the right tone. Just like bad news bears, benchwarmers and the perfect game this movie is very funny and is an all around good movie for the family to watch. I recommend this movie to any sports fans that love a little action with a lot of comedy,i rate this movie a 4 out of 5.
The sandlot has returned but this time its different kids and a new team and for having it be a SQL its pretty good! Its a silly movie.

They turned the dugout into a dollhouse.

The previous Sandlot picture took place in the 60s.  This Sandlot picture takes place at the same Sandlot ten years later when a new group of children, with similar looks and nicknames as the first film, embark on similar adventures as the first film...but this time there are some girls in the picture to complicate things.

"Love conquers all."

David Evans, director of The Sandlot, Radio Flyer, First Kid, The Final Season, Beethoven's 3rd & 4th, Tranced, and Smitty, delivers The Sandlot 2.  The storyline for this picture is essentially the exact same as the original with little new features that make this worth viewing.  The feel is still appropriate, but the characters have less depth and are less interesting.  

"Women need a man like a fish needs a bicycle."

I recently came across this on Netflix and decided to watch it with my daughter.  She absolutely loved it from beginning to end and was glued to it (I was so proud of her).  This is a gigantic step down from the original, but worth viewing if nothing else is available.

"Stay away from the kissing booth."

Grade: C
Considering how this is a sequel with new characters I thought it was pretty good to watch.

Essentially a remake of the original, except worse in every conceivable way. A truly wretched baseball movie, devoid of any enjoyment value. Avoid this movie at all costs unless you enjoy scraping the bottom of the movie barrel.
This wasn't good or bad really is all I have to say.
This movie was alright!
Don't bother with this sequel. They copy and pasted the first one and added girls. Laziest attempt at a sequel I've EVER seen.

This is the worst movie I've ever seen. For a time, I liked the first, and still consider it a classic of sorts. I would have hoped this second one to be a movie that followed up on the original characters, but instead I ended up watching a movie exactly the same as the original with even lower production value and shittier scenes.

Not even close to been as good as the first Sandlot. They pick up ideas from the other Sandlot film. It doesn't seem like they have any new ideas for this appalling sequel with very little laughs to offer, the cast isn't very good and it is also one of the worst sequels I have seen. The only newish idea in this sequel is that the new gang face there toughest challenge as they try to retrieve an irreplaceable model rocket that lands in Mr Mertle's (James Earl Jones) backyard behind left field- a forbidden territory guarded by a legendary growling slobbering beast known as the great fear. The great fear was originally called the beast from the first Sandlot but for some reason they go and change the name. It was such a disappointment.
Ugh. Why tamper with the first one. Bad sequel to a good movie
I didn't know there was a first Sandlot film but I loved Sandlot 2.  No way the first one is better than this one.
This, along with Popeye with Robin Williams goes down as one of the worst movies I have ever seen. The original was a great movie and remains an classic. This is an absolute piece of garbage.
This movie tried to be good, but it failed REALLY HARD!

Basically just a carbon copy off the first one. The movie is bombarded with a crap script, terrible wooden acting, and it fails completely at coming up with anything new or original that is entertaining. Another dumb sequel that nobody ever asked for. I did think though that the film brought down it's horribleness a bit towards the end and I liked the scene with James Earl Jones because he is the only person in the entire movie with REAL acting talent.
Trying to milk the success of the first one with this movie. It's decent but definitely not as good as the first one.

Question: Is it possible to rate this zero stars? cause this movie is well deserving.

This movie is horrible. I don't ever associate this with the classic original. This is just pointless.
Another childhood classic.

Complete Garbage! Absolutely everything about this movie makes me angry! It is in every way a cheap rip off of the classic original, only one problem (well OK a lot of problems but this is a big one) none of the characters are likable!!! They're all obnoxious ass holes, especially the Benny Want-to-be! They try adding in stuff about equality of genders which is great but they completely crap on that by making the girls in the group the lamest of all, 2/3 OF THEM AREN'T EVEN ON THE COVER OF THE MOVIE!!!! I was hoping they'd have more James Earl Jones because unlike the original he's actually in a lot of the trailer, but he's only in like 5 minutes, and I could tell he didn't want to be there. This movie is a DISGRACE!!! A lazy stupid sequel that will forever haunt me!
Not living up to the first one, The Sandlot 2 is semi- funny, but not worthy of the title.

Over the years, "The Sandlot" has become outdated (as far as sequels go), but the studio must have seen a silver lining in this script, because it was made, and to put it nicely, it sucks. It is a complete rehash of the original, going beat-for-beat. It just gets more and more annoying as the film progresses. I would almost call this movie a remake if it wasn't for a few minor changes. The direction is sloppy, the same effects are reused, and the script is thinner than most sequels I've seen in recent time. I despised the writer as I was watching this film. I don't know how someone could be so uninspired. "The Sandlot 2" is more than just a bad film, it's an insult to the original. Even though there are a few minor references to old characters, there is nothing to see here.

a remake of the first but I give it a thumbs up because they didnt do over the first one they continued it with the next group of kids that played on the lot and told their story  ,, I give this 5 stars .. no thats what all sequels should do
This movie is The Star Wars Prequels of David M. Evan's career. It's that bad, and that unforgivable.
this movie was really good
This was a cute movie, one to watch with your kids.
loved this movie then all the rest
IT SHOULD NOT HAVE BEEN MADE!!!!!!!!!

This was one of the movies I saw once,hated it. Saw twice,liked it. Very good storyline,nice love story,and pretty good for a sequel. With also some scary scenes (a.k.a. the bigfoot house,skull formed in washing machines,the story of Fear,and the size of the dog.) But very sad at the end. Overall,ok!
